Package hw7

Class quickSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw7.quickSort
  • public class quickSort
extends java.lang.Object
    quickSort class that sorts a map by count of characters.

      • quick_sort

        public void quick_sort​(int[] values,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> aux,
                       int left,
                       int right)
        This is a recursive implementation of the quicksort algorithm that sorts an array of integers and an ArrayList of strings.
        Parameters:
        values - an array of integers that needs to be sorted using the quick sort algorithm.
        aux - The "aux" parameter is an ArrayList of Strings that is used as an auxiliary array during the quick sort algorithm. It is used to temporarily store the sorted values during the merging process.
        left - The index of the leftmost element in the subarray being sorted.
        right - The index of the rightmost element in the subarray being sorted.

      • partition

        public int partition​(int[] values,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> aux,
                     int left,
                     int right)
        The partition function takes an array of integers and an ArrayList of strings, and partitions the array based on a pivot value, while also swapping the corresponding values in the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        values - an integer array that needs to be sorted using the quicksort algorithm
        aux - The "aux" parameter is an ArrayList of Strings that is used as an auxiliary array during the quick sort algorithm. It is used to temporarily store the sorted values during the merging process.
        left - The index of the leftmost element in the array or subarray being partitioned.
        right - The index of the rightmost element in the subarray being partitioned.
        Returns:
        The method is returning an integer value, which is the index of the pivot element after partitioning the array.

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        This method prints the original map and the sorted map.
